medical_history.chief_complaint: Falls, weakness, dark urine, and difficulty swallowing.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 17 months prior with a stroke causing weakness on the left side, followed by progressive generalized weakness and fatigue. Two weeks before admission, the patient experienced difficulty swallowing leading to subsequent symptoms. One week before admission, a mechanical fall occurred due to weakness, followed by darkening of urine four days later and episodes of slurred speech.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, nonischemic cardiomyopathy, glaucoma, ileus, colonic polyps, degenerative disease of the cervical spine.

family_history.father: Died of myocardial infarction at 79 years of age.
family_history.mother: Had hypertension and osteoarthritis that led to a hip replacement.
family_history.brother: Diagnosed with prostate cancer in his 50s.

medical_history.social_history: Lives alone, works as an administrator, walks with a cane at baseline, does not use alcohol, tobacco, over-the-counter or herbal medications, or illicit substances.
